Confession:
 Some of my biggest (paying) clients who connected with me on LinkedIn…
 I used automation to help me.

But…
Automation wasn’t the key to converting them from not-so-cold, to lukewarm, to warm, to hot.

What actually moved the needle?

 👉 The heart to care.
 👉 A service-first mindset.
 👉 And showing absolute expertise..consistently.

That’s why I don’t get how some people oversell their automation tools.
It’s maybe 10% of the equation.

 The rest?
 You still have to show up.

 Think. Serve. Build trust. Solve problems.

Am I saying I’m great at it?

 Nope. Still learning. Because things shift fast.

What worked a few months ago?
 Stopped working.

 I had to think on my feet and evolve- again.

𝐈 𝐟𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐝 𝐚 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐮𝐥𝐝 𝐚𝐮𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐝 𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡 𝐭𝐨 𝐇𝐑𝐬 𝐨𝐧 𝐋𝐢𝐧𝐤𝐞𝐝𝐈𝐧... 𝐛𝐮𝐭 𝐢𝐭 𝐰𝐚𝐬 𝐛𝐫𝐨𝐤𝐞𝐧.

No updates in 4 years.
No replies to issues.
Most people would’ve let it die.
I didn’t.

A few months ago, I stumbled upon a GitHub repo that promised something incredible:
✅ Scrape employees from your dream companies
✅ Analyze their job history
✅ Auto-send tailored connection requests with resumes

But LinkedIn had evolved. The code? Outdated and non-functional.
I had no idea where to start—but I knew I didn’t want this idea to go to waste.

So I rolled up my sleeves, forked the repo, and started learning.
I’m proud to share what I’ve built so far:

🚀 𝐋𝐢𝐧𝐤𝐞𝐝𝐈𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐁𝐨𝐭
 An automation tool that helps you connect with professionals (especially HRs) from your dream companies—with custom messages.

𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞’𝐬 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐢𝐭 𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐥𝐲 𝐝𝐨𝐞𝐬:
• Prioritizes HR profiles from target companies
• Sends custom messages based on role
• Plans smart outreach even around LinkedIn’s connection note limit (approx. 5/month for standard accounts)

✨ I’m also working on a feature that stores pending messages and sends them after your request is accepted.

This was my first automation project. I made tons of mistakes. But I learned even more.

Huge thanks to Avish Mehta for the foundation, and to Mohit Kumar Singh for helping me figure out the messy parts and pushing me forward 🙌

Curious to see this in action? Want to collaborate or suggest features? Drop a comment or DM.

 What’s the most clever job-hunting tool you’ve seen or built? 👇 Let’s share ideas.

🚨 My LinkedIn Account Was Hacked — Please Read! 🚨

Recently, my LinkedIn account was compromised and used to create fake hiring pages for fraudulent recruitment activities. Despite having 2-step verification enabled, the attacker managed to gain access — a clear reminder that even strong security can be bypassed in some cases.
As a result, my account was suspended due to a high volume of automation activity, which violated LinkedIn’s guidelines. The recovery process involved complex government ID verification and several frustrating steps.

🔒 Key Takeaways for Everyone:
- Regularly review your LinkedIn login history and connected apps.
- Stay away from clicking any links in LinkedIn which looks unsecure [Eg: Apply for this job by the below link]
- Avoid using the same passwords across platforms.
- Be cautious with browser extensions or apps linked to your LinkedIn.
- Consider using an authenticator app instead of SMS for 2FA.
- Keep a backup of your LinkedIn data — just in case.

I’m back now — but this experience was a real eye-opener.

If you received any suspicious messages from me recently, I sincerely apologize. Stay safe out there — the threat is real, even in professional networks.

Despite the critical role QA plays in product success, many relevant service categories are still missing from LinkedIn’s official service listings. Here are a few that should be added:

1. Manual Testing
2. Quality Assurance
3. Test Automation
4. QA Consulting
5. Software Testing & QA Mentorship
6. Functional Testing
7. Regression Testing (Manual)

If you're a QA professional, consultant, freelancer, or mentor—you probably found yourself trying to fit your services under generic tags like IT Consulting or Software Development.

It’s time for LinkedIn to recognize the specialized skill sets and value that QA professionals bring to the tech ecosystem.
